intro: Crocodeilanthe franciscensis, commonly known as the Francisco's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of feathery leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
